section.div: Favorites genres: Action, Drama, Comedy, Adventure

div.div: Goblin Slayer Gaiden 2: Tsubanari no Daikatana

Goblin Slayer Gaiden 2: Tsubanari no Daikatana is a spin-off series of the main Goblin Slayer! light novel. This is the first manga adaptation of the light novel.
Set 10 years prior to the original series, the story centers around Sword Maiden's party of six adventurers on their journey to the Dungeon of the Dead to kill the Demon Lord.
A prequel series that reveals Goblin Slayer's past and the events that led him to become an adventurer with the sole purpose of exterminating all goblins from the world.

A lonely boy wandering the Arctic regions of North America meets a wolf, and the two become fast friends, depending on each other to survive the harsh environment. But the boy has a history, and the wolf is more than meets the eye as well â€¦
(Source: Kodansha USA)

Zaha Sankoâ€™s body has great and terrible powersâ€“they say that possessing his bones will grant you any wish, even the desire to become ruler of the universe. But Sanko is still a teenage dude with his own life, and he isnâ€™t about to let every monstrous lowlife in the galaxy rip him limb from limb. He and his skeletal buddy Avakian will use their dark powers to fend off any murder attempts while they search space for whomever put this curse on Sankoâ€™s bonesâ€¦because killing them might end the madness. (Source: Seven Seas Entertainment)
Action, Comedy, Drama, Romance, Sci-Fi, Supernatural

Ghosts, monsters, aliens, teen romance, battles...and the kitchen sink! This series has it all! Takakura, an occult maniac who doesn't believe in ghosts, and Ayase, a girl who doesn't believe in aliens, try to overcome their differences when they encounter the paranormal! This manga is out of this world! (Source: MANGA Plus) Notes: - Includes 1 extra chapter. - Nominated for the 15thÂ Manga Taisho Award in 2022.
Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo!

Kazuma Sato is a video game-loving shut-in-or at least he was, until a humiliating traffic accident brings his young life to an untimely end. But after his death, a beautiful girl claiming to be a goddess invites him to enter another world and gain some respectable perks in the process. But Kazuma's choice is going to have serious consequences for the goddess and the dead man alike... (Source: Yen Press)

In this new action-comedy, everything about a young man named Saitama screams "AVERAGE,” from his lifeless expression, to his bald head, to his unimpressive physique. However, this average-looking fellow doesn't have your average problem... He's actually a superhero that's looking for tough opponents! The problem is, every time he finds a promising candidate he beats the snot out of them in one punch. Can Saitama finally find an evil villain strong enough to challenge him? Follow Saitama through his hilarious romps as he searches for new bad guys to challenge!
(Source: Viz Media)

In the late 19th century, Great Britain rules over a quarter of the world. Nobles sit in their fancy homes in comfort and luxury, while the working class slaves away at their jobs. When young Albert James Moriartyâ€™s upper-class family adopts two lower-class orphans, the cruelty the boys experience at his familyâ€™s hands cements Albertâ€™s hatred of the nobility he was born into. He asks the older of the two boysâ€”who has a genius mind and a killer instinctâ€”to help him rid the world of evil, starting with Albertâ€™s own family!
(Source: Viz Media)

A Bride’s Story tells the tale of a beautiful young bride in nineteenth-century Asia. At the age of twenty, Amir is sent to a neighboring town to be wed. But her surprise at learning her new husband, Karluk, is eight years younger than her is quickly replaced by a deep affection for the boy and his family. Though she hails from just beyond the mountains, Amir’s clan had very different customs, foods, and clothes from what Karluk is used to. As the two of them learn more about each other through their day-to-day lives, the bond of respect and love grows stronger. (Source: Yen Press) Note: Won the Prix IntergÃ©nÃ©rations ("Intergenerational Award") at the AngoulÃªme International Comics Festival in 2012 and the 7th Manga Taishou award in 2014.
Action, Comedy, Slice of Life, Supernatural

The master spy codenamed <Twilight> has spent his days on undercover missions, all for the dream of a better world. But one day, he receives a particularly difficult new order from command. For his mission, he must form a temporary family and start a new life?! A Spy/Action/Comedy about a one-of-a-kind family! (Source: MANGA Plus) Notes: - Includes 2 "Extra Missions" and 10 â€œShort Missionsâ€. - Nominated for the 24th Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize in 2020. - Nominated for the 13th and 14th Manga Taisho Award in 2020 and 2021. - Nominated for the 44th Kodansha Manga Award in the Shounen Category in 2020.
